item.title: Sucker Punch Doesn't Want to Make a New Sly Cooper Game
item.description:
The potential for a new Sly Cooper game from its original development team seems increasingly unlikely following recent comments made by one of Sucker Punch's creative directors. Sucker Punch pioneered the Sly Cooper franchise, and while more recent games featuring the master of the Thievius Raccoonus have been handled by Sanzaru Games, many of fans' most fond memories are tied to the series' early entries.

Along with series like Jak and Daxter and LittleBigPlanet , Sly Cooper is generally considered one of PlayStation's best forgotten franchises from the early 2000s. The first three games in the series were released between 2002 and 2005, and while Sanzaru picked up the reins for anthology The Sly Collection in 2010 and original adventure Sly Cooper: Thieves in Time in 2013, the original trio from Sucker Punch still holds a strong place in the hearts of many gamers.

Sucker Punch Is Likely Done With Sly Cooper

But recent comments from Sucker Punch co-creative director Nate Fox indicate that there's very little interest from the creative team in reclaiming the anthropomorphic raccoon's franchise. Fox recently appeared on YouTube channel MinnMax, giving quick responses to 125 different questions over the span of about 12 minutes. A few of those questions centered around the Sly Cooper games, and when asked how many team members would be excited if he announced that they would be working on a new title in the series, Fox estimated he would get a positive reaction from just 10 percent of his staff. When the interviewer expressed surprise at this response, Fox pointed to the two decades that have passed since Sucker Punch developed a Sly Cooper game as justification.

Sly Cooper may have been Sucker Punch's first major hit, but it isn't the developer's only claim to fame. It also saw success with the action-adventure series Infamous between 2009 and 2014, and it is currently working on Ghost of Tsushima sequel Ghost of Yotei , which is scheduled for launch on October 2. Asked in the same interview about an old Fox response to a fan letter that claimed the company would lose money if it abandoned Sly Cooper , the creative director humorously addressed that fan, saying, "I hope you like Ghost of Yotei ."

Fox's recent comments show no budging from previous statements the studio released in 2022, in which it stated Sucker Punch had no plans to revive Sly Cooper or Infamous . That statement was released in response to rumors that new games for each of those two series were in the works, and while Fox's new comments indicate little interest from Sucker Punch, it seems there are plenty of fans eager to dive into a new adventure with Sly Cooper.

item.title: Best Rafa Build in Borderlands 4
item.description:
All three of Rafa's build paths in Borderlands 4 are capable of causing serious mayhem, but if you're looking for something that's easy to use while still being extremely powerful, then the Peacebreaker route is likely going to be the best one for you.

Peacebreaker cannons may not seem like they do much at first, but once you get the right skills, they turn into what might just be Rafa's strongest assets so far in Borderlands 4 . This build focuses on extending this Action Skill's uptime as much as possible while also cranking up its damage potential so much that they'll likely end up being stronger than your own weapons.

Best Beam Team Peacebreaker Rafa Build in Borderlands 4

For this build, we'll be using the Beam Team Capstone skill that turns Rafa's Peacebreaker's into Shock/Corrosive beam weapons. This gives you an edge against Order enemies that often use both armor and shields together, and through one other skill, Peacebreakers will deal bonus Incendiary damage as well .

To summarize, this build will make you truly overpowered in Borderlands 4 by doing the following:

  • Deal Shock, Corrosive, and Incendiary damage through two individually-targeting Peacebreaker cannons.
  • Constantly restores 15% of your active Action Skill duration on crits.
  • Greatly increases the damage of thrown guns, Action Skills, and Grenades.
  • Increases survivability by providing damage resistance and healing Rafa through Action Skill/Thrown Gun Lifesteal.
  • Allow non-weakspot crits.

Skills

The following is optimized for a Level 45 character , though the core functionality of this build will go online as soon as you get Instinto and Beam Team. Grab these skills in descending order :

Skill

Effect

Peacebreaker Cannons

Activates two shoulder-mounted turrets that shoot at enemies for a duration.

Sitiar

Gain increased 25% Gun Damage.

Deft Hands

Rafa and his Peacebreaker Cannons gain 20% increased Fire Rate.

Juerga

Restore Action Skill Duration by 15% when Rafa critically hits enemies. This has a 4-second cooldown.

Instinto (Augment)

Peacebreaker Cannons gain 25% Critical Hit Chance. Activate Action Skill again while Peacebreaker Cannons is active to double their crit chance and gain increased Critical Hit Damage while also causing Action Skill Duration to drain faster. When Rafa kills an enemy, Action Skill Duration is restored by 10%, but it also drains faster.

Confeti

Rafa's Ordnanced deal bonus damage based on his current gun's element.

Concentrated Build Up

Aiming down sights makes Rafa's guns deal bonus Shock damage. Dealing damage while aiming increases the bonus Shock damage until Rafa stops aiming.

Beam Team

Peacebreaker Cannons now shoot Corrosive and Shock beams that can target enemies independently. Every time Rafa applies a Status Effect, he gains bonus Action Skill damage.

Asymmetric Warfare

Increases the damage of Indirect Projectiles by 45%. Indirect Projectiles include all Action Skill weapons, Thrown Guns, and any projectile not fired from your gun.

Errant Spark

All Indirect Projectiles deal bonus Incendiary damage. If the Indirect Projectile already deals Incendiary damage, double this bonus.

Hostile Acquisition

Rafa's Indirect Projectiles have 50% Lifesteal

Inspirado

When Rafa inflicts a Status Effect on an enemy, he gains increased Action Skill Cooldown Rate and reduced Action Skill Duration Rate. This effect stacks.

El Alacran

Targets hit by Peacebreaker Cannons have an increased chance to receive Status Effects.

Resiliencia

Rafa gains increased Damage Reduction when Overdrive is active.

Max these skills out as soon as you are able.

To play this build, simply turn your Peacebreaker Cannons on and let them do all the work. Focus on avoiding hits and scoring critical hits so you can keep Peacebreakers up for as long as possible. This setup allows you to have your Action Skill active for the entire duration of most fights, including boss fights.

Specializations

The Daredevil Specialization tree is the perfect one for this build since it significantly buffs your Action Skill. Get 10 points into Sharpshooter and Runner ASAP, then max Daredevil out. This build is strong enough even without Specializations, and these will only make Rafa even stronger than he already is.

Alternatively, you can go with 20 Brawler to get the Riddle Me This skill, which grants you bonus Gun Damage whenever you deal Gun Damage. This won't buff Peacebreaker Cannons, but it'll give you a much-needed DPS boost.

Weapons and Equipment

Any weapon will do for this build, especially once you're leveling up. However, you'll want to use either fully-automatic or semi-automatic elemental guns with big magazine sizes to take advantage of your Skills and Specializations.

Ideally, you should be using either a Vladof, Tediore, or Ripper gun with Maliwan Licensed Parts . They can have any element, though Radiation and Cryo would be best since you already deal the other damage types through your Peacebreakers.

The Swarm Grenade and Filantropo Class Mod Legendaries synergize well with this build. The former quickly fills the screen with enemy-seeking darts, while the latter spawns an extra Swarm Grenade whenever you re-trigger your Action Skill. Copies of Legendary Class Mod can drop from almost every boss and chest, while Swarm Grenades can be farmed from Syndey Pointylegs in The Prospects, a Ripper Drill Site west of the Someday Rise Safehouse in Fadefields.

Class Mod Skills

When farming for a Class Mod, try getting one that gives any of the following bonus stats:

  • Ordnance Damage
  • Action Skill Duration
  • Action Skill Damage
  • Gun Damage.

As for bonus Skills, look for the following:

  • CYA (Red Tree)
  • Arriba (Blue Tree)
  • El Soldado (Blue Tree)
  • Brain Dump (Blue Tree)
  • Midnight Oil (Green Tree)
  • El Borracho (Green Tree)

Basically, anything that gives Rafa bonuses to his Action Skill is going to be great with this build . Skills that also improve his survivability will be very useful when pushing for higher UVH ranks.

Peacebreaker builds feel a lot like playing Zane in BL3 â€” turn your Action Skill on, and go in guns blazing.

If you can't get a copy of the Filantropo Legendary Class Mod, find one that has any of the bonuses listed above. The Filantropo mod isn't necessarily required for this build, but it does make fighting enemies easier when paired with a good Grenade mod. If you'd much rather use Ordnance weapons, then a purple Class Mod with good stats and bonus skills will be better than a Legendary class mod.

Gun Enhancements and Firmware

For your Enhancement item, make sure to use one that synergizes with your main weapon, or one that gives ideal bonus stats like Status Effect Damage or Gun Critical Hit Damage . Still, you'll want an Enhancement with a perk that works for your guns, like Vladof's Bullet Hose perk that gives every shot a chance to fire an extra projectile.

For Firmware, anything that increases your damage or survivability is good. Make sure to visit Zane's Firmware machines so you can keep your gear up to date.

item.title: Borderlands 4: How to Claim Pre-Order Bonuses
item.description:
Borderlands 4 has finally arrived, and those who pre-ordered the game can claim 5 Legendary weapons, 1 skin usable by all Vault Hunters, 1 Head usable by all Vault Hunters, a weapon skin, and an ECHO-4 Drone skin. These bonuses come from the Gilded Glory Pack, available as a separate purchase or to those who pre-ordered Borderlands 4 before September 12. However, those logging in for the first time might want to know when, how, and where they can nab these exclusive bonus items.

How to Claim Pre-Order Items in Borderlands 4

After starting a New Game and selecting your Vault Hunter, access your Inventory menu, where to the right (where ECHO-4 is), you will see a Reward Pop-Up. Players can select this Reward to see the Gilded Glory Pack, which can be claimed to accept the Legendary weapons obtained via pre-ordering Borderlands 4 . To obtain your free cosmetics, simply head into the Customization menu in the inventory tab, and you will be able to go through your selection of bonuses for the Vault Hunter Head, Skin, ECHO-4 Skin, and Weapon Skin. It's worth noting that of the weapons players get, the SMG can be used at Level 1, whereas the Grenade and Rocket Launcher can be used at Level 30, and the Assault Rifle is locked for Level 50.

item.title: How to Farm Boss Fights for Legendary Loot in Borderlands 4
item.description:
When a boss fight is so good in Borderlands 4 , you can't help but want to do it all over again. Equipped with new skills and weapons, replaying a boss fight will prove that you're a Vault Hunter who just won't quit, especially when there's legendary loot on the line. Having a re-do on a boss fight in Borderlands 4 is essential for players looking to farm some shiny new weapons with unique characteristics, and below, players will find exactly how to do it and why they should.

How to Replay Boss Fights in Borderlands 4

What Do Moxxi's Big Encore Do in Borderlands 4?

Once players have beaten a boss in Borderlands 4 , they can head back to any boss arena to find Moxxi's Big Encore station . If players interact with this station, they will pay Cash to replay the boss fight, which respawns the boss in the arena and allows players to beat them once more. Moxxi's Big Encore allows players to replay boss fights infinitely, without the need to exit and re-enter the game like previous entries in the series. Players can now replay boss fights in exchange for in-game Cash, and this can be done with any boss from the main story, contract, or side mission, so you can always grind for exclusive quest loot. Once activated, players can fight the boss in the hopes that they drop amazing loot, but even if they don't, simply activate Moxxi's Big Encore again and keep fighting the boss to farm them.

Moxxi's Big Encore is the most effective way to farm legendary gear in Borderlands 4 , as players can get both XP and loot from defeating familiar bosses that they've encountered before, albeit without the power that they now possess. It's also worth noting that each week (during the endgame), there will be a Weekly Big Encore Boss that players can fight on repeat with Cash and Eridium, which will be a more powerful variant of a boss, but with extra loot drops and better chances for legendary gear.

item.title: Genshin Impact Can No Longer Be Downloaded on PS4
item.description:
One of the most popular free-to-play multiplayer games on PlayStation 4 â€” Genshin Impact â€” has been officially delisted from the console's PlayStation Store. This marks the first step in developer HoYoverse's plans to cease Genshin Impact operations on PS4, with further decommissioning slated for 2026.

Genshin Impact first launched in 2020 on PC, PS4, and mobile platforms, and didn't take long to become a global phenomenon. Evidently, Genshin Impact was initially a PS4 console exclusive, which helped build a millions-strong userbase for the live-service open-world RPG on PlayStation. In 2021, HoYoverse brought Genshin Impact to PS5 natively, and the game made its Xbox Series X/S debut in 2024. With Genshin Impact now on most current-gen systems, HoYoverse recently confirmed that it was ready to leave the 12-year-old PS4 behind.

New Genshin Impact PS4 Downloads are No Longer Possible

The decision to end further development of Genshin Impact on PS4 stemmed from limitations pertaining to "hardware performance and platform application size," as per HoYoverse, which implies that the developer may have ambitious future updates in mind that the aging PlayStation system could struggle with. Now, starting today, September 10, Genshin Impact has been entirely removed from the PlayStation Store on PS4. That means any PS4 user who doesn't have Genshin Impact in their digital library can no longer access or download the game .

Existing Genshin Impact players still have some time left to enjoy the game on PS4, but changes are on the horizon. HoYoverse will disable in-game purchases for Genshin Impact on PS4 from February 25, 2026, onwards, cutting players off from the gacha-driven microtransactions that are central to the game's progression system. Then, April 8, 2026, will mark the full discontinuation of PS4 support for Genshin Impact â€” no new updates from there on out â€” and users won't be able to log in at all. For current Genshin Impact PS4 players, HoYoverse strongly encourages binding accounts and preparing to migrate to a new platform, like the PS5, Xbox Series X/S, PC, or mobile.

While Genshin Impact 's looming PS4 shutdown is unfortunate for users of the Sony system, it should be noted that these plans will come to fruition in year six of the PS5 generation and likely enable HoYoverse to deliver bigger, more technically grand updates for the game. Many other studios have moved on from the PS4 and Xbox One, including the upcoming current-gen-only Battlefield 6 , and it was only a matter of time until Genshin Impact would do the same. Moreover, PS5 sales were recently announced to have crossed 80 million units, so the newer console's adoption is clearly reaching a point where lots of developers are comfortable dropping previous-gen systems.
